messages: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (07:55): BenMillard, if you read the archives (and I think you do), blog design looks great!
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (07:55): definitely a lot better than having the default

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (08:04): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, setAttribute behaves differently in HTML and XML, dataset is defined in terms of setAttribute and does not do anything with the string beforehand (e.g. lowercasing)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:04): dataset isn't defined in terms of setAttribute.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:04): (well, except for the exception stuff)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:04): (but that's unrelated to what we're talking about here)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (08:05): ah, that's confusing
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:07): it is?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:07): why is it conusing
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:07): what is confusing
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:07): i'm confused.

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (08:08): the "If setAttribute() would have raised an exception when setting an attribute with the name name, then this must raise the same exception." made me think the algorithm was the same as for setAttribute...
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:09): it would have said so if it was
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (08:09): true
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (08:10): hopefully DOM core defines an abstract way of setting an attribute that we could use << zcorpan
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (08:10): that would also avoid potential confusion if setAttribute was prototyped or something like that
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:11): that would be nice
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:17): i worked out why that guy used such long paragraphs
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:17): he in fact broke his paragraphs as much as he could
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:17): it's just that some of his sentences were very long
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (08:26): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: hmmm
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (08:26): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: i'm not sure if hedral's technique counts as smart or stupid
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:27): well it works
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:27): stupid would be just bashing his head against the frame
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:27): i.e. something that doesn't work
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:27): it may not be optimal, though...
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (08:27): hehehe

47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (08:49): on canvasrenderingcontext
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (08:54): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: the ffx nightlies already support it, and i have a prototype implementation for webkit
